channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Black Friday sales flyers are already leaking out, including ones from Walmart, Target and Home Depot
item.description: Start your planning (and in some cases shopping) now.

item.title: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy hates bureaucracy so much he’s planning to increase the ratio of employees to managers
item.description: The e-commerce giant says bureaucracy creates inefficiency.

item.title: With Trump Tariffs Looming, Businesses Try to ‘Run From a Moving Target’
item.description: Companies are filling their warehouses or looking into moving factories as they weigh President-elect Donald J. Trump’s threats to impose tariffs on f...

item.title: Russia Hits Ukraine with Drones, Missiles Overnight
item.description: Millions trek to shelters nightly or take their chances at home as unceasing missile and drone attacks drag on. Some Ukrainians are looking — with hop...

item.title: Notre-Dame’s Bells Ring Together for First Time Since Fire
item.description: The sound of Notre-Dame’s bells pealed throughout Paris for the first time since 2019 — a symbol of rebirth as it prepares to reopen next month.

item.title: Bird flu begins its human spread, as health officials scramble to safeguard people and livestock
item.description: Some experts say mass human-to-human transmission of this strain of bird flu is only a matter of time.

item.title: Temu faces second EU probe for misleading sales practices
item.description: Potential EU fines over misleading practices are escalating the scrutiny of Temu as regulators push the e-commerce giant to comply with consumer-prote...

item.title: Notre-Dame Cathedral’s Bells Ring as Restoration Nears Completion
item.description: The ringing of Notre-Dame’s bells sounded throughout Paris for the first time since the fire in 2019.

item.title: Beyoncé and Young Women Pop Sensations Lead 2025 Grammy Nominations
item.description: Charli XCX, Billie Eilish, Chappell Roan and Sabrina Carpenter will compete in the biggest categories, along with Taylor Swift and Kendrick Lamar.

item.title: Responsible AI Means IT Security Has to Evolve
item.description: Artificial intelligence and IT security are converging. Thoughtful companies will develop processes so AI makes their systems more, not less, secure.

item.title: Gazan Rescue Service Has Stopped Operating in the North
item.description: Residents had to dig through rubble in search of their neighbors after the main emergency service in Gaza said it had stopped operations in the north ...

item.title: Party Whose Leader Is Known for Antisemitism Joins Lithuanian Government
item.description: A new coalition includes a party led by a politician notorious for antisemitic remarks, another blow to the longstanding refusal by Europe’s mainstrea...

item.title: Judge Tosses Out Biden Program For Undocumented Spouses
item.description: The ruling issued by a federal judge in Texas struck down a new initiative aimed at helping undocumented spouses of U.S. citizens stay in the country.

item.title: With Trump Tariffs Looming, Businesses Try to ‘Run From a Moving Target’
item.description: Companies are filling their warehouses or looking into moving factories as they weigh President-elect Donald J. Trump’s threats to impose tariffs on f...
